answers.answer: Prednisone [note spelling] is a synthetic steroid. Prednisone will cause a rise in blood sugar [glucose], therefore, hyperglycemia can occur. I can personally attest that this statement is true. Stay away, it does the body no good.

question: My Orthopaedist wants to do nerve root block injections using steroids (Predisone).  I was diagnosed with type II diabetes in Dec 2006.  I was recently allowed to stop taking Metformin.  I am doing great with just my diet alone.  Have not had a BG level over 115 without meds.  I am terrified that the injections will raise my BG levels and that I will end up back on medication.  Does anyone have any experience with this type of situation?Thanks in advance,MonaMcV
title: Experiences with Epidural Steriod Injections
